summary: This is an email forwarding chain from July 8, 2008, containing a victim notification letter related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. The email references a draft declaration and the original letter sent to defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz on November 28, 2007, by an Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.context: Recipient of the email forwarding the victim notification letter. Referenced in the email chain as 'Acosta, Alex (USAFLS)'.

persons.name: Jay Lefkowitz
persons.context: Recipient of the original victim notification letter sent on November 28, 2007, as referenced in the email.

connections.description: Connected through legal correspondence regarding the Epstein case, specifically the forwarding of a victim notification letter from the prosecution to the defense.

events.title: Victim Notification Letter Sent
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney in West Palm Beach sent a victim notification letter to defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Forwarding Victim Letter
events.description: An email was sent forwarding the November 2007 victim notification letter to Alex Acosta, referencing a draft declaration and the defense's objection to the original letter.

keyFacts: A victim notification letter in the Epstein case was sent to defense attorney Jay Lefkowitz on November 28, 2007.
The defense objected to the original victim notification letter, as referenced in a draft declaration.
The correspondence involves Alex Acosta, who was the U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of Florida at the time.
The document shows official communication between prosecution and defense regarding victim notification procedures.
The email is dated July 8, 2008, forwarding the 2007 letter, indicating ongoing case management.
